intro: Pseudolysimachion rotundum f. album, commonly known as the white-flowered roundleaf pseudolysimachion, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its round, fleshy leaves and showy white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique appearance makes it a sought-after specimen for botanical gardens and specialized collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
